intro: Dubautia raillardioides, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and the flowers range in color from white to pale purple. Dubautia raillardioides is also known for its resilience to coastal conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
